item1_summary:
Cboe Global Markets, Inc. delivers cutting-edge trading, clearing and investment solutions to people around the world . Company provides trading solutions and products in multiple asset classes across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific . Company is committed to building a trusted, inclusive global marketplace that enables people to pursue a sustainable financial future .
 Options segment includes options on market indices (“index options”), as well as on the stocks of individual corporations . Options are eligible to trade, as applicable, on Cboe Options, C2, BZX, EDGX, and/or other U.S. national security exchanges . North American Equities segment includes corporate listing services .
 The Europe and Asia Pacific segment includes the pan-European listed equities and derivatives transaction services, ETPs, including exchange traded funds, exchange traded notes, and exchange traded commodities . It also includes the ETP listings business on RMs and clearing activities of Cboe Clear Europe, as well as the equities transaction services of Australia and Japan, respectively .
 The Futures segment includes transaction services provided by CFE, a fully electronic futures exchange . The Global FX segment includes institutional FX trading services that occur on the Cboe FX fully electronic trading platform . The Digital segment includes a regulated futures exchange (Cboe Digital Exchange) and a regulated clearinghouse . Prior to May 31, 2024, the Digital segment also included a U.S.-based spot digital asset trading market .
 The Company plans to transition the cash-settled margin Bitcoin and Ether futures contracts, currently available for trading on the Cboe Digital Exchange, to CFE in the first half of 2025, pending regulatory review . The key sources of these revenues are our equities and FX markets, the U.S. tape plans, and our clearing and listings businesses, which are described in more detail below .
 The key sources of these revenues are proprietary products, including our flagship products SPX options and VIX options and futures, our derivatives markets, and U.S. tape plans, which are described in more detail below . Cboe delivers cutting-edge trading, clearing and investment solutions across the globe through a comprehensive ecosystem that helps drive innovation and growth .
 Cboe is one of the largest U.S. derivatives market operators, operating four options markets and operating a futures market, CFE, as well as operating a pan-European derivatives market . The company launched new products and indices such as cash-settled margin Bitcoin and Ether Futures, options on VIX Futures and options thereon .
 Our U.S. derivatives options market, Cboe Options, is a hybrid market combining open outcry floor trading with electronic trading . For proprietary products, we use price-time or pro-rata allocation, alongside public customer priority in certain instances, and market turner, combined with a pricing model . Our most frequently traded proprietary products include SPX options and VIX options and futures .
 Cboe pioneered the trading of exchange-traded volatility products with its introduction of VIX futures in 2004 and VIX options in 2006 . The VIX Index (as defined below), although not directly tradable, is based on the mid-point of real-time quotes of SPX options and is designed to reflect investors’ consensus view of future 30-day expected stock market volatility .
 VIX Weeklys options and futures, mini VIX futures, and nearly 24x5 trading in VIX options . We also calculate and disseminate proprietary indices that are licensed for use by third parties or are used as the basis for Cboe proprietary products . These proprietary indices are built through our in-house research and development teams, often in connection with our strategic relationships with index providers .
 The Company has long-term business relationships with several providers of market indices . We license their indices, including on an exclusive basis, as the foundation for indices, index options and other products . The Company also has agreements in place to work jointly with key providers to develop new indices and products and services that are expected to capitalize on our core competencies and diversify our sources of revenue .
 We have a worldwide license through August 22, 2025 to offer futures, options, and options on futures on indices designed to reflect values of investment grade and high-yield U.S. corporate bonds . We use market data from the trading of options on these indices to create Cboe volatility indices, variance indicators and BuyWrite indices .
 The Cboe Data Vantage business provides an offering of market data and information solutions products across multiple asset classes and geographic regions . The agreement with MSCI Inc. (MSCI) in which we have the right to offer U.S.-listed options on several of the indices . We use . data from the trading of the M.SCI EAFE and MSCi Emerging Markets index options (among other . inputs) to calculate volatility indices .
 Cboe is one of the largest equities market operators, operating four U.S. equities exchanges, international exchanges in Europe, Canada, Japan and Australia . We distribute real-time cryptocurrency prices and indicative net asset values . We also derive a portion of our revenue from market data fees from the United States Tape Plans .
 Cboe and BIDS Trading collaborate in operating similar venues with our cash and spot markets in Australia, Canada, Europe, and Japan . The U.S. equities exchanges, BZX, EDGX, BYX and EDGA, which are fully electronic, operate various market and pricing models .
 Cboe operates five listing venues across the globe that are structured and designed, in the U.S. and Canada, for all types of equity instruments, such as ETPs, corporate securities, warrants and depositary receipts . In the UK and EU, listings are only for ETP, while in Australia, both ETP and warrants are supported .
 In 2024, Cboe Clear Europe provided CCP protection for an average of €49 billion of cleared value on a daily basis . Through the process of netting, in 2024, the company eliminated 70% of the average daily cleared value, leaving an average daily settlement value of €15 billion . As of November 25, 2024, it also launched a first-of-its-kind service for SFT in cash equities and ETFs .
 The industry in which we operate is intensely competitive . Access to our markets and trading rights and privileges depend upon the nature of the customer, such as whether the individual or firm is (or is) eligible to become) a trading permit holder or trading privilege holder . For information regarding risks related to our customers see “Risk Factors.”
 The listed options industry is extremely competitive . As of December 31, 2024, our four options exchanges compete with 14 other U.S. options exchanges . We compete favorably with respect to these factors through a variety of methods, including access to a broad array of products and services, including proprietary products and market data . We also compete against other futures exchanges and swap execution facilities that offer similar products .
 Our major competitors in Europe include national stock exchanges, other pan-European MTFs, systematic internali. nt markets and pricing models on existing technology . The market for execution and clearing services in Europe became more competitive following the introduction of MiFID II and the Regulation on Markets in Financial Instruments (Regulation . No 600/2014)
 The global FX market remains severely fragmented, with transparent automated marketplaces challenging a small number of similarly situated competitors . The electronic spot FX market is also intensely competitive, with over 10 other venues competing for market share . Cboe Data Vantage faces competition from other securities exchanges, technology companies, third-party market data providers, and information and software vendors .
 Using common protocols and features, Cboe’s unified CboE Titanium technology platform is designed to offer customers an efficient, consistent experience regardless of where they are in the world . Our exchanges provide different market models, appealing to different user bases, and the trading technologies support all of them . The technologies are designed to support many specialized features for each of the markets, such as dark pools, trade reporting facility, systematic internalizer, Large-in-Scale, smart order routing, FLEX options, and hybrid trading .
 We regularly test our data center recovery plans and periodically carry out weekend tests using our back-up data centers, as well as an annual test with our U.S. trading participants . We are exploring the potential use of new technologies, such as artificial intelligence (“AI”), machine learning, blockchain, distributed ledger technology, quantum computing, the cloud, and other emerging technologies .
 ASX Clear Pty Ltd acts as a central counterparty on all transactions occurring on Cboe Australia . Japan Securities Clearing Corporation (JSCC) is the sole provider of clearing on all equities transactions . LCH Limited and LCH SA (LCH SA) and SIX x-clear Ltd clear trades in European listed equity securities and exchange traded products as part of an interoperable clearing model .
 Cboe Trading’s clearing firms are Wedbush Securities, Inc. and Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC (“Morgan Stanley”) The CBOe Digital spot market is closed for all participant and trading purposes as of May 31, 2024, the CboE Digital spot trading market is now closed . The company does not engage in proprietary trading activities and does not maintain a trading entity .
 Rule 605 and the Tick Size/Access Fee Cap proposals were approved by the SEC in December . The proposals could result in increased technology and compliance costs to Cboe . In addition, additional proposals or changes to the existing equity market structure could have a negative impact on the CBOe . The proposal is being considered by the U.S. Securities and Treasury Department .
 SEC released a proposed rule that would impact the way in which volume based discounts are applied . If adopted as-is, this Volume Based Proposal would prohibit national securities exchanges, including Cboe’s equities exchanges, BZX, BYX, EDGX, and EDGA, from offering volume-based transaction pricing in connection with the execution of agency or riskless principal orders in NMS stocks .
 European Council published its proposal for a review of EU market structure legislation . MiFIR rules came into effect on March 28, 2024 . The deadline for transposing MiFID II amendments is September 29, 2025 . The legislation, as drafted, does not appear likely to have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition, and operating results .
 The Exchanges are SROs, each registered under Section 6 of the Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (“Exchange Act”) as a “national securities exchange” and are subject to oversight by the SEC . An exchange SRO is responsible for operating its trading platforms consistent with its rules, and regulating its members .
 The law prohibits certain fees to be paid to the government from being used for non-profit purposes . The law also prohibits the use of money to pay for the purposes of the law . The rule states that the money must be used to pay the bill for the purpose of the bill . The bill is required to be approved by the Supreme Court of Appeals .
 The SEC will typically publish the proposal for public comment, following which the SEC may approve or disapprove the proposal, as it deems appropriate . Certain categories of rule changes, like fee changes, can be effective on filing, but the SEC retains the ability to suspend or reject such filings within a prescribed period of time . Cboe Canada Inc. is subject to comprehensive regulation and oversight by the OSC .
 The operations of each of CFE and Cboe SEF are subject to regulation by the CFTC under the Commodity Exchange Act . The CFTC generally requires futures trading in the U.S. be conducted on a designated contract market . CFE is required to comply with the applicable core principles and regulations under the CEA .
 Cboe Digital Exchange is a CFTC-registered designated contract market . CboE Clear U.S. has surrendered or is in the process of surrendering its money transmitter licenses in the states where such licenses or equivalent were required to conduct business in connection with the CBOe Digital spot market, which closed on May 31, 2024 . If CFE fails to comply with applicable laws, rules or regulations, it may be subject to censure, fines, cease-and-desist orders, suspension of its business, removal of personnel or other sanctions .
 Cboe Europe surrendered its BitLicense from the New York Department of Financial Services (“NYDFS)’s” The current UK regulatory system was established by the Financial Services Act 2012 . Financial conduct of markets, including activity on, and the operation of, markets is regulated by the FCA, which is an independent non-governmental body .
 Cboe Clear Europe is recognized as a non-UK CCP in the United Kingdom, which allows it to provide services to UK Clearing Participants and UK trading venues . The AFM is accountable to the Dutch central bank, financial sector supervisor and resolution authority . The DNB is committed to a stable financial system: stable prices, solid financial institutions and properly functioning payment transfers .
 The Dodd Frank Act and MiFID II and MiFIR in Europe have impacted the regulatory landscape for currency derivative products . Cboe FX issued a Statement of Commitment declaring its commitment to conduct its FX market activities in a manner consistent with the principles of the FX Global Code . Any decision to impose new regulations may affect our spot FX business line .
 Cboe Trading is considered a facility of each of the Exchanges . BIDS Trading is not a member of any of the U.S. national securities exchanges and is not subject to exchange rules . The Exchanges are responsible for enforcing the compliance with their rules, including to ensure CBOe Trading isn’t given preferential treatment . The SEC, SROs and state securities commissions may conduct proceedings which can result in injunctions or other sanctions .
 The SEC and FINRA impose certain minimum capital requirement rules that require notification when a broker-dealer’s net capital falls below certain predefined criteria . Cboe intends to maintain the BIDS ATS as an independently managed and operated trading venue, separate from and not integrated with the Exchanges .
 The SEC may exercise direct supervision and disciplinary authority over certain Cboe Global Markets’ activities and those activities may be subject to SEC approval and, in some cases, public notice and comment . U.S.-based exchanges are responsible for assessing the compliance of their TPHs or members, including CBOe Trading, with the respective exchange’s rules .
 In order to ensure market integrity, we regulate and monitor our TPHs’ and members’ trading activities by using both our employees and/or third parties under regulatory services agreements . Providing effective regulation is important for attracting and retaining the confidence and participation of market-makers, broker-dealers and institutional and investors .
 The Exchanges and CFE have entered into agreements with FINRA under which FINRA has agreed to provide regulatory services to the Exchanges . Under these agreements, FINRA performs certain regulatory functions on behalf of our markets . Under certain other instances for our Exchanges, a third party has been allocated the regulatory responsibility under Rule 17d-1 .
 The Exchanges remain responsible for the regulation of their TPHs, members and marketplaces . The OCC has performed and continues to perform certain regulatory functions on behalf of CFE pursuant to an RSA with CFE . CFE retains overall responsibility for regulation of its marketplace and for bringing disciplinary actions against its TPH and members . Cboe Trading’s assigned DEA is FINRA .
 Cboe Options, C2, BZX, EDGA, and EDGX are member exchanges in OPRA, which is the designated securities information processor for market information that is generated through the trading of exchange-listed securities options in the U.S. The Exchanges have entered into certain other multi-party Rule 17d-2 agreements that allocate responsibility among the participating SROs, which may include the Exchanges .
 Cboe Options, BZX, EDGA, and EDGX are also parties to the NMS plan for the selection and reservation of securities symbols . The ORSA Plan is intended to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency with which the exchanges regulate their respective markets and to avoid duplication of certain regulatory efforts . The Consolidated Audit Trail Plan (“CAT Plan”) serves as the national market system plan pertaining to the creation, implementation and maintenance of a CAT that tracks orders throughout their lifecycle .
 On November 15, 2016, the SEC approved the CAT Plan and a phased implementation was originally required to begin in November 2017; however, there were some delays . The first phase of CAT (“Phase 1”) ultimately went live in November 2018, at which time we and other SROs/Plan Participants began initial reporting of order and trade file submissions to the CAT .
 SEC issued an order approving an amendment to the CAT Plan to implement a revised funding model (“CAT Funding Model”) for CATLLC to fund the CAT . The approved CAT Funding Model contemplates two categories of CAT fees calculated based on the “executed equivalent shares” of transactions in eligible securities .
 As of September 3, 2024, CATLLC began assessing transaction-based fees to CAT Executing Brokers for Buyers and Sellers to cover a portion of prospective CAT costs . d will continue to do so until the balance due to be collected is paid in full, estimated to occur over approximately 24 months from the fee's implementation .
 American Securities Association (ASA) and Citadel Securities, LLC (Citadel) filed a Petition for Review of the CAT Funding Model Order in the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit . The Company expects Plan Participants will no longer issue additional short-term notes to CATLLC to fund CAT .
 The allowance for notes receivable credit losses associated with the CAT is calculated using a methodology that is primarily based on the structure of the notes and various potential outcomes under the CAT Funding Model . The funding of the implementation and operation of the CAT may not be collectible, including if the SEC finds that the SROs/Plan Participants did not satisfy any of the financial accountability milestones .
 Cboe is committed to applying our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy to all employment practices that impact the terms and conditions of employment including, but not limited to, hiring, evaluation, discipline, promotion, training, compensation, transfer, and termination . We believe that our collective and unique perspectives fuel our capabilities, enhance our team spirit .
 Cboe expects employees to perform their duties to the best of their ability and to develop their competencies for career growth . The company's vision is to support the overall wellness of employees and their families through education and activities that encourage a healthy lifestyle . Our programs and benefit plans provide a corporate atmosphere of collective well-being and incorporate strategies for physical, emotional, mental and financial wellness .
 In 2024, Cboe conducted its seventh annual employee engagement survey and implemented career, leadership, and culture focused programs in response to the survey findings . Senior management team continues to hold the commitment to an open-door policy and encourages the free flow of information and communication in furtherance of active transparency . Human Resources also provided ongoing regular resources and tips to help support the challenges, from hybrid work to childcare and elder care .
 The development of all Cboe employees helps drive our collective success . Through skill and competency development we signal our investment in our employees . Through our tuition reimbursement program, our employees receive financial support in their pursuit of specialized university courses and degrees . Leaders can participate in Lead the Way’s leadership development hybrid program focused on in-person facilitated workshops and exercises .
 As of December 31, 2024, we employed 1,685 individuals in the following locations: The remaining 885 employees provide business development, financial, regulatory, human resources, compliance, legal, planning and research, administrative, and managerial support . Fredric J. Tomczyk is our current Chief Executive Officer and director .
 Catherine R. Clay is our Executive Vice President, Global Head of Derivatives, a position she has held since October 2023 . She served as Chief Executive Officer of Livevol, Inc. from 2013 to 2015 . Catherine Clay also served as Cboe Data Vantage's Chief Strategy and Chief Strategy Officer from March 2021 to March 2021 .
 Stephanie Foley is Executive Vice President, Chief Human Resources Officer . Jill M. Griebenow is Executive VP, Chief Financial Officer of Cboe Exchange, Inc. Ms. Foley previously served as Founder of Thales LLC from 2006 through 2010 . David Howson is Executive President, Global President, a position he has held since May 2022 .
 Adam Inzirillo is our Executive Vice President, Global Head of Cboe Data Vantage (f/k/a Data and Access Solutions), a position he has held since October 2023 . Christopher A. Isaacson is our Chief Operating Officer, Chief Information Officer . Christopher Isaacson was appointed to the Company’s acquisition of Equiduct in January 2019 .
 Patrick Sexton is Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary . Allen Wilkinson is Senior Vice President and Chief Accounting Officer of the Company . Allen Isaacson was one of the founders of Bats. He has served in various senior leadership positions since 2005 . Mr. Isaacson also serves as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of Cboe Digital Exchange and CBOe Clear U.S.
 The Company files annual, quarterly and current reports, proxy statements and other information with the SEC under the Exchange Act . Mr. Wilkinson is a certified public accountant and holds master’s and bachelor's degrees in accounting from the University of Missouri – Columbia . We will provide a copy of these documents without charge to stockholders upon written request to Investor Relations .
